org.modelio.api.modelio.diagram

Interface IDiagramHandle

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public interface IDiagramHandle
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable

    This class is used to manipulate a diagram's content. @since 2.0

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
        Close this diagram handle and release associated ressources.
        This IDiagramHandle mustn't be used any longer after calling this method.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • getCreationFactory

        IDiagramGraphicFactory getCreationFactory()
        Get the diagram graphics creation factory.

        To be used to unmask elements and create new diagram drawings.

        Returns:
        the diagrams graphics creation factory.
        Since:
        3.1

      • getDiagram

        AbstractDiagram getDiagram()
        Get the element this IDiagramHandle is related to.
        Returns:
        the represented element.

      • getDiagramGraphics

        java.util.List<IDiagramGraphic> getDiagramGraphics(MObject element)
        Returns the list of diagram graphic representing (ie: for which the getElement() method does return the element of) the given reference in this diagram or an empty list if none is found.
        Parameters:
        element - a model element for which we are searching graphics.
        Returns:
        the list of all diagram graphics representing the passed reference, or an empty list if none is found.

      • getDiagramNode

        IDiagramDG getDiagramNode()
        Get the diagram graphic for the diagram itself.
        Returns:
        a diagram node.

      • getDrawingGraphic

        IDiagramGraphic getDrawingGraphic(java.lang.String identifier)
        Return the drawing graphics matching the given identifier.

        Returns null if no drawing graphic matches the identifier.

        Parameters:
        identifier - a drawing graphic identifier
        Returns:
        the matching drawing graphic
        Since:
        3.1

      • isLayoutAssistantEnabled

        boolean isLayoutAssistantEnabled()
        Tells whether the layout assistant is enabled for this session.

        The layout assistant is disabled by default while the diagram is open with the diagram API.

        The layout assistant may be enabled by calling setLayoutAssistantEnabled(Boolean) with true as parameter.

        Returns:
        whether the layout assistant is disabled in the viewer properties.
        Since:
        3.4.1

      • mask

        void mask(IDiagramGraphic graphic)
        Mask a graphical element in the diagram.
        Parameters:
        graphic - The graphical element to remove from the diagram.

      • save

        void save()
        Save the diagram in Modelio.

      • saveInFile

        void saveInFile(java.lang.String format,
                java.lang.String targetFile,
                int margin)
        Saves the diagram image in a file with the specified name. The format parameter can have one of the following values:
        • "PNG"
        • "BMP"
        • "JPEG"
        • "GIF"
        The margin parameter allows to define the size of margins to use around the actual content.
        Parameters:
        format - the format to write the images in.
        targetFile - the name of the file to write the image to.
        margin - the margins to add around the content of the diagram.
        Since:
        2.1.1

      • setBatchMode

        void setBatchMode(boolean batchMode)
        Sets the batch edition mode on/off.

        Activating the batch edition mode should be used as a memory consumption optimization when applying lots of modification to a single diagram in a single transaction (e.g. when using the API to layout a diagram) to avoid potential saves of intermediary states of the diagram.
        Callers should turn batch edition mode off once modifications are done and call save() to actually save the applied modifications.

        Note: Batch edition mode is automatically turned off when close() is called but it is considered good practice to turn it off explicitly (particularly since close() may be called silently by a try -with-resources statement managing this diagram handle).

        Parameters:
        batchMode - true if batch mode should be engaged.
        Since:
        2.2.1

      • setLayoutAssistantEnabled

        void setLayoutAssistantEnabled(java.lang.Boolean enabled)
        Set whether the layout assistant is enabled.

        The layout assistant is disabled by default while the diagram is open with the diagram API.

        The layout assistant may be disabled until the diagram is closed by calling this method with false.

        Parameters:
        enabled - whether the layout assistant is enabled.
        Since:
        3.4.1

      • unmask

        java.util.List<IDiagramGraphic> unmask(MObject element,
                                       int x,
                                       int y)
        Unmask a model element in a diagram.

        The model element is unmasked at the given position.

        Parameters:
        element - the model element to unmask.
        x - the x coordinates of the unmasking position.
        y - the y coordinates of the unmasking position.
        Returns:
        a list of all the new diagram graphics. Might be empty, but not null.

      • refreshDynamicDecoration

        void refreshDynamicDecoration()
        Make sure the dynamic decoration is applied.

        Call this method to force the diagram to refresh its overwritten properties if no model changes were triggered.

        Since:
        3.6
